text: The P. D. Houston Jr. House is a historic mansion in Forest Hills, Tennessee. Also known as Woods Cote, it was built in 1941 for P. D. Houston Jr., a banker who became the president of the First American National Bank in 1957. With . It was designed in the Tudor Revival architectural style by Warfield and Keeble. It was purchased by Norris H. Nielsen and his wife Britton in 1972. It has been listed on the National Register of Historic Places since October 27, 2003. ==References== Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in Tennessee Category:Tudor Revival architecture in the United States Category:Houses completed in 1941 Category:Buildings and structures in Davidson County, Tennessee Category:1941 establishments in Tennessee
title: P. D. Houston Jr. House
